Topic.Title: Game works on its own, but not when uploaded to site

Posts.EditableText: I have a game made on Squiffy, and I've published it [here](https://textadventures.co.uk/games/view/n75ibwewuuq2rxoekae1aw/you-dont-know-jack-text-adventure-ep-1). However, even though the game works in the Preview window and as a downloaded standalone HTML/JS page, it doesn't work on the website. What gives?
Posts.HTML: I have a game made on Squiffy, and I've published it here. However, even though the game works in the Preview window and as a downloaded standalone HTML/JS page, it doesn't work on the website. What gives?

Posts.EditableText: I played all the way through (I don't want to mention my score). It might be your browser - I'm on Firefox and it worked just fine.
Posts.HTML: I played all the way through (I don't want to mention my score). It might be your browser - I'm on Firefox and it worked just fine.

Posts.EditableText: Works for me just fine! Cool visual design, btw.
Posts.HTML: Works for me just fine! Cool visual design, btw.

Posts.EditableText: Oh, so it takes minutes or hours for it to be ready to play? I wish I knew that...
Posts.HTML: Oh, so it takes minutes or hours for it to be ready to play? I wish I knew that...

Posts.EditableText: Minutes? Hours? It took only some seconds to play your game
Posts.HTML: Minutes? Hours? It took only some seconds to play your game

Posts.EditableText: No, he's talking about the update time. Yes, sometimes when you post a game they update instantly. Sometimes it can take up to a day. I've learned to put version numbers on my front screen so I can tell when it updates.
Posts.HTML: No, he's talking about the update time. Yes, sometimes when you post a game they update instantly. Sometimes it can take up to a day. I've learned to put version numbers on my front screen so I can tell when it updates.

Posts.EditableText: I've noticed that the http version of the site responds to new uploads and reuploads much faster than the https version.
Posts.HTML: I've noticed that the http version of the site responds to new uploads and reuploads much faster than the https version.
